title: Three Bangladesh nationals arrested with fake Greek visas
byline: Three Bangladesh nationals were arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) for attempting to tavel to Greece with forged  Greek resident visas.

title: Security boosted in Colombo for festive season
byline: Police said that security will be heightened in Colombo during the upcoming festive season.

title: Four vehicles crash and pileup at Gelanigama on Expressway
byline: Four vehicles traveling towards Colombo from Matara on the E01 crashed and piled up at the 25.5-mile post near the Gelanigama Interchange on the Southern Expressway this morning, the expressway Police said.

title: Picnic turns tragic as girl drowns, teacher rescued at Nayaru Beach
byline: A 19-year-old girl drowned and two others, including a teacher, were hospitalized yesterday (March 31) after they swept away by the waves while bathing at the Nayaru Beach in Kokkilai.

title: Japan warns ‘big one’ earthquake could kill 300,000 people
byline: Japan’s long-dreaded “big one” earthquake could kill almost 300,000 people along its urbanised Pacific coast, create 12.3mn evacuees and cause $1.8tn of economic damage, a new government forecast has warned.

title: Sri Lanka emphasises equitisation to reform  SOEs and bolster capital markets
byline: The government is prioritising equitisation as a key strategy to enhance the governance of state-owned enterprises (SOEs) and inject liquidity into the capital market, instead of embracing full privatisation, which has garnered negative sentiment among the Sri Lankan public, according to the comments by Securities and Exchange Commission of Sri Lanka (SEC) Chairman Senior Professor Hareendra Dissabandara.

title: VAT to drive one-third of govt.’s Rs.922bn revenue increase in 2025
byline: Nearly one-third of a Rs.922 billion rise in the government’s revenue projection for 2025 is expected to be driven by the value added tax (VAT), an analysis conducted by local analytics platform PublicFinance.lk showed.

title: IRD introduces tax relief for small savers with new self-declaration system
byline: Sri Lanka’s Inland Revenue Department (IRD) has introduced a simplified self-declaration process to alleviate the 10 percent advance income tax (AIT) burden on interest earnings for the low and middle-income earners.

title: CID statement given on Trincomalee pilot vessel accident
byline: Social activist and complainant Sanjaya Mahawatte yesterday said that he had given a successful statement to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) for nearly four hours regarding an accident involving a modern pilot vessel stationed at the Trincomalee Harbour, which resulted in a loss of over Rs. 250 million.

title: Update: Man jumps off ITC hotel; note found saying ’I’m sorry, mother’
byline: A 30-year-old man jumped from the ITC Ratnadipa Luxury Hotel near Galle Face Green after leaving a written note stating that he took his own life due to unbearable stress, the police said.

title: Australian woman injured in train accident while taking selfie
byline: An Australian woman travelling on the Badulla-bound Odyssey Express train from Colombo Fort on Monday evening (31) sustained serious injuries after hitting her head against an iron post near the railway line between Nanu Oya and Ambewela stations while attempting to take a selfie from the footboard.

title: No legal barrier in bringing motion to remove Deshabandu as IGP: Justice Minister
byline: Justice Minister Harshana Nanayakkara said there is no legal barrier in bringing a motion to remove suspended IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon from the office of IGP as claimed by former Justice Minister Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe.

title: Sri Lanka will uphold Buddhist values in supporting Myanmar, Thailand: Sajith
byline: Sri Lanka will always fulfill its duty towards earthquake-hit Myanmar and Thailand, preserving true Buddhist values, Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: Govt aid for students affected by elephant intrusions
byline: The government has decided to provide financial assistance to support the uninterrupted education of children from families affected by frequent elephant intrusions into their villages.

title: Sathasivam Viyalendran further remanded
byline: Former State Minister Sathasivam Viyalendran, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has been further remanded until April 8.

title: 100mm showers expected in coming days
byline: The atmospheric conditions are becoming favourable for afternoon thundershowers, with rainfall of about 100mm expected in most parts of the island over the next few days, the Forecasting Division of the National Meteorological Centre said.

title: Burst Petronas gas pipe sparks colossal fire in Malaysian suburb
byline: A colossal fire erupted Tuesday in a Malaysian suburb outside Kuala Lumpur due to a burst gas pipeline, prompting evacuations of nearby homes.

title: MAS supports Sri Lankan athletes ahead of Asian Under-18 Athletics meet
byline: The MAS Athlete Training Academy, an initiative of MAS Holdings, has provided sports gear and per diem sponsorships to promising athletes and coaches set to compete at the Asian Under-18 Athletics Championships in Dammam, Saudi Arabia, in April 2025.

title: Haiti gangs storm town and release 500 inmates from jail
byline: Gang members stormed the town of Mirebalais in central Haiti on Monday and released about 500 inmates from prison.

title: Death Sentence for Underworld Figure in Borella Murder Case
byline: Colombo High Court Judge Navaratna Marasinghe today sentenced underworld gang member S.F. Sarath to death for the murder of Hettiarachilage Duminda, also known as Chanaka, who was shot dead at the Yoga Salon in Borella Vanathamulla on the night of August 1, 2014.

title: Three-wheeler fares to remain unchanged despite fuel price reduction
byline: Despite the Rs. 10 reduction in petrol prices, there is no possibility of lowering three-wheeler fares, the All-Island Three-Wheeler Drivers’ Association (AITWA) said.

title: Milco slashes yogurt and fresh milk prices by Rs.10
byline: Milco (Pvt) Limited has decided to reduce the price of Highland Yogurt and a litre of fresh milk by Rs. 10 from today.

title: PC election will not be held this year: Nalinda
byline: Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said Provincial Council election will not be held this year as three elections were held within six months with the upcoming Local Government elections.

title: CA suspends election activities in nomination disputed LG institutions
byline: The Court of Appeal today directed the relevant Returning Officers to suspend the election activities until tomorrow (02), in relation to Local Government institutions where political parties and independent groups have filed petitions challenging the rejection of nomination papers.

title: TIN made mandatory for all services at Department of Motor Traffic
byline: The Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN) has been made compulsory for obtaining all services from the Department of Motor Traffic (DMT).

title: Elephant topples safari jeep in Yala National Park
byline: An elephant was seen toppling a safari jeep in Yala National Park while tourists were inside the vehicle.

title: Pakistan’s former PM Imran Khan nominated for Nobel Peace Prize
byline: Jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan has been nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize for his efforts for human rights and democracy. Members of the Pakistan World Alliance (PWA) – an advocacy group founded last December – who also belong to the Norwegian political party Partiet Sentrum, announced the nomination of Khan, 72.

title: Chamara Sampath further remanded till April 8
byline: The Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court today ordered that former Uva Provincial Councillor and former Minister Chamara Sampath Dasanayake be further remanded till April 8 over the alleged withdrawal of six fixed deposits maintained by the Uva Provincial Council in a State bank at Badulla in 2016.

title: Sri Lanka set to lose $ 1Bn FDI with Adani moving out
byline: Sri Lanka is set to lose US $ 1 billion in FDI since Adani wind power project in Mannar is now uncertain with both the project company and the Sri Lankan government remaining firm on tariff rates, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Two Japanese ships arrive in Colombo
byline: The Japan Maritime Self-Defence Force (JMSDF) Bungo and Erajima arrived at the port of Colombo on a goodwill visit today.

title: Colombo to witness rare celestial event on April 7
byline: Residents of Colombo are set to witness a rare celestial phenomenon on Monday, April 7, 2025, at exactly 12:12 p.m., when shadows will momentarily disappear.

title: Wildlife Dept. plans action to prevent train-elephant collisions
byline: The Wildlife Conservation Department has taken steps to develop an action plan to minimize the damage caused to wild elephants due to collisions with trains.

title: Colombo bourse kicks off on bullish note
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) opened April on a strong footing, with the All-Share Price Index (ASPI) gaining momentum to close with bullish sentiment. Trading activity was marked by significant volatility, as dividend counters dragged the market down while capital goods sector stocks provided upward support. The ASPI rebounded from its intraday low, surging by 224 points to end the session on a positive trajectory.

title: Nuwara Eliya April festival commences
byline: The Nuwara Eliya April Festival, organized by the Nuwara Eliya Municipal Council, commenced today with Central Province Chief Secretary G.H.M. Ajith Premasinghe as the chief guest.

title: Police open fire at Minuwangoda injuring one
byline: Police opened fire at a roadblock in Minuwangoda during a narcotics check leaving one person injured and another arrested, police said.

title: New government initiative offers nutritious meals for Rs. 200
byline: A new government initiative aimed at ensuring food security and making nutritious meals affordable for the public was officially launched today (01) at the ’’Palessa’’ restaurant of the National Food Promotion Board in Narahenpita.

title: Excise orders 26 booze makers to print production date on bottles, cans from April 1
byline: The Excise Department of Sri Lanka yesterday ordered all 26 soft and hard liquor manufacturing companies in the country to print the production date of their spirits on the respective bottles and cans with effect from April 1st.

title: Govt to launch insurance scheme for ‘Kithul’ and Palmyra workers
byline: The Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board has announced plans to introduce a life insurance scheme for workers in the ‘Kithul’ (Caryota urens), coconut, and ‘Thal’ (palmyra) industries in Sri Lanka.
